net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api

Class OptimisticLockingException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.NlsRuntimeException
            • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.OptimisticLockingException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, NlsThrowable, AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode, AttributeReadUuid, NlsObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OptimisticLockingExceptionHibernate, OptimisticLockingExceptionJpa, OptimisticLockingExceptionSpring

    public class OptimisticLockingException
extends NlsRuntimeException
    This is a variant of exceptions like OptimisticLockException that is suitable for end-users and support NLS/I18N.
    Since:
    7.3.0
    Author:
    hohwille
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • OptimisticLockingException

        public OptimisticLockingException(Throwable cause,
                                  Object entity,
                                  Object id)
        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        cause - is the cause such as OptimisticLockException or ObjectOptimisticLockingFailureException.
        entity - the entity representation (e.g. simple name of the entity class).
        id - the ID of the entity.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

      • isForUser

        public boolean isForUser()
        Specified by:
        isForUser in interface NlsThrowable
        Overrides:
        isForUser in class NlsRuntimeException
        Returns:
        true if the message of this exception is for end-users (or clients), false otherwise (for internal technical errors).

      • of

        public static OptimisticLockingException of(Throwable optimisticLockError)
        Creates an OptimisticLockingException for the given Throwable cause.
        Parameters:
        optimisticLockError - a Throwable like StaleObjectStateException, OptimisticLockException, or ObjectOptimisticLockingFailureException.
        Returns:
        the wrapped OptimisticLockingException or null if the given Throwable is not a known optimitisc locking exception.
